definitions: Past tense of screw: to fasten or tighten with a screw or screws.
Past tense of screw: to twist or turn something with a screwing motion.
Past tense of screw (informal): to have sexual intercourse with someone.
Past tense of screw (informal): to cheat or swindle someone.
Past tense of screw (informal): to treat someone unfairly or badly.
examples: He screwed the lid onto the jar.
She screwed up the paper into a ball.
They felt completely screwed by the deal.
The company screwed its employees out of their bonuses.
